tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: I\'m a graduating senior and thought back to who my favorite professor was... It\'s Professor Hassell. Class was always dynamic! It was reading intensive (and I\'m an engineering major so I wasn\'t too excited about it), but it was totally worth it. He\'s cool and laid back in class but encourages students to learn and do their best.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: amazing; wish I would\'ve found him sooner. very down to earth and great at what he does. lectures expand on readings, not just review. takes time to clarify & is available outside of class. no exams, but daily reading & writing assignments. lots of extra credit opportunities. if you aren\'t going to dedicate the time to this class, don\'t bother.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: This is not a course you can just show up and get an easy A, but it is possible with hard work. No exams, and you can show him assignments early to see what grade you would get. It is a writing intensive course. He is fairly liberal, not a course to "Learn about your religion." Tons of extra credit. Too much reading from WRT. I learned something.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: HIS CLASS IS MADE TO BREAK YOU. That said, if you want to actually learn things with an incredibly knowledgeable, engaging, and laid-back professor, sign up for a course with Hassell. He\'s top notch - one of my favorite professors. Has extremely high standards but if you do the reading and put 110% effort into your work, you\'ll be highly rewarded.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Professor Hassell knew his stuff and taught it well. I learned a lot from his assignments and lectures! There was quite a bit of homework but if you do it well he grades fairly.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Take this class if you want to think.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Hassell is the BOMB! His classes are interesting, fun, and fulfilling. You will feel accomplished about every task you do, as he will make you work hard for your grade, but trust me, it is worth it... He completely changed my opinion on what philosophy is, as it was my first PHL course.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Very fun class, fun professor, but a quite a bit of work. I\'d probably take him again.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: YOU HAVE TO TAKE CLASSES WITH THIS GUY. He is the most inspirational and generous i have ever met. He has changed my life to say the least and i\'ll never look at philosophy or Immanuel kant the same. This has been the best semester of my life because of this man. If youre debating taking this class, DO IT. Plus, hes probably the funniest man i know

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: This class was very difficult, but he told you exactly what was expected in order to succeed. He also provided a ton of additional help. He is a great teacher, but you have to be willing to work hard.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Really nice guy but his class is REALLY tough. Some of the concepts can be hard to grasp at times. Make sure that you start the project as soon as you can, it takes a lot of time to do it right. Buy the old edition of the books, they are a LOT cheaper. I got a 4.0 but it took a LOT of effort. Don\'t take him unless you are serious.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Belated review but here it is. One of the best classes I\'ve had. Grades returned very quickly. Rubrick included in the syllabus. Very clear and challenging. The material is difficult but the ideas are beautiful. Excellent discussion. Be warned the professor caught several people plagiarizing who he failed. He requires arguments not opinions.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I heart Hassell. Just signed up for two more of his in the fall

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Cool format for an online class. Lots of discussion. The first book is hard at first but all the reading gets easier with practice. The last few are incredible.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Best class. Awesome professor. Actually getting my money\'s worth! Lazy people need not apply

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Overall I liked his class. He\'s laid back, esp with grading. If you do the all the work you\'ll be fine. I barely read any readings because they were so complicated but if you refer back to your notes when you write your papers, You will be fine. He offers lots of extra credit and it\'s an all writing class

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: average professor, talk alot and have interesting discussions but a lot of reading and does not provide feedback on assignments. Do Not take him if you need a good grade

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Read 3 high level books.A summary for each chapter cavanaugh.answer 3 discussion questions for each chapter of world religions.&analyze a novel.offers tons of extra credit.Hassel makes this class really interesting, and he is always willing to read rough drafts&give advice. put the work in and its an easy A.guaranteed to change world view.<3ed it!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I hated every minute of this course. Overload of material in a short time. He expects a lot from you on papers but never explains what he wants and gives no feedback, just sticks a grade on your paper. Gives extra credit like reading an extra novel which is far more work than extra credit should be. Don\'t take him.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Extremely unorganized and very vague. Don\'t waste your time trying to ask what he is looking for. In addition, he rarely replies to e-mails. When he does reply they are often confusing or need clarification. Nice guy, terrible professor.
